newsitem.title: UK: Aon forms UK motor accident management firm.
newsitem.headline: Aon forms UK motor accident management firm.

text.p: U.S. insurance broking group Aon has teamed up with Dresdner Kleinwort Benson to form the largest vehicle accident management company in Europe, Aon said on Tuesday.
Aon Risk Services has become 50 percent owner of VELO Motor Accident management Ltd, with the other 50 percent held by VELO Ltd, a subsidiary of Dresdner Kleinwort Benson.

"This creates a new force in fleet accident and risk management which we believe will put us light years ahead of the competition," Mike Eve, Aon Risk Services executive director, said at the Association of Insurance and Risk Managers (AIRMIC) conference.
The new company, with a staff of 120, will manage more than 110,000 fleet vehicles for 300 top UK companies and have a database of more than 350,000 claims.
It has invested more than 1.5 million stg in technology, including a video link system which allows managers to keep control of work done in garages.
The company currently operates only in the UK, but Eve said he intends to push into Germany and other European markets in 1998.
Aon Risk Services was formerly part of Bain Hogg, the UK broker acquired by Aon last year.
